task.title: Linking with a related-links Element in DITA

context.p: To create a list of related links within the topic you are writing (as opposed to specifying relationships externally with a relationship table):

step.cmd: Open the topic where you want the link to occur.

In Author mode, place the caret below the topic body element (the name of the body element may vary from one topic type to another). An easy way to get the caret in the right place is to click below the text of the topic and press the up arrow once.
Press Enter. The Content Completion Assistant appears.
To add links to the related-links element, you can either hit Enter and select link from the Content Completion Assistant or use the insert link button on the DITA toolbar.

taskbody.result: This creates a related links section in your topic. DITA provides the linklist and linkpool elements to help you refine how your links are created and processed. See the DITA documentation for details.
